alert.note: Alert for Millard (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 3:20PM MDT until July 24 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Millard County in central Utah... * Until 500 PM MDT. * At 320 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.35 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Halfway Hill Burn Scar and downstream ares. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Halfway Hill Burn Scar, Chalk Creek, Pine Creek, and Dry Creek... Fillmore. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.1 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
